text: Michael Bradley "Mike" Enzi (February 1, 1944 - July 26, 2021) was a United States Senator from Wyoming from 1997 to 2021. He was a member of the U.S. Republican Party. == Early life and education == Enzi was born on February 1, 1944 in Bremerton, Washington. He studied at George Washington University and at University of Denver. On May 4, 2019, Enzi announced that he would not seek reelection to a fifth term in the Senate. == Personal life == He was married to Diana Buckley. They had three children. Enzi was a super-conservative, the term used for an extremely conservative person. Six months after retiring from the Senate, Enzi was in a bicycle accident on July 23, 2021 in which he broke his neck and several ribs. He died three days later at a hospital in Loveland, Colorado, aged 77. ==References== ==Other websites== * Mike Enzi, U.S. Senator for Wyoming, Home Page Category:1944 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American mayors Category:United States senators from Wyoming Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Road accident deaths in the United States Category:Businesspeople from Wyoming Category:People from Bremerton, Washington Category:Politicians from Washington (state) Category:Businesspeople from Washington (state)
title: Mike Enzi
